DOC.brief_title: A Dose-ranging Study DRM01 Subjects With Acne Vulgaris
DOC.criteria: Signed informed consent . Male nonpregnant , nonlactating female . Age ≥ 18 year . Clinical diagnosis facial acne vulgaris define : At least 20 inflammatory lesion At least 20 noninflammatory lesion Investigator Global Assessment 3 great . Active cystic acne acne congoblata , acne fulminans , secondary acne . Two active nodulocystic lesion . Screening clinical chemistry hematology laboratory value consider clinically significant , opinion Investigator . Abnormal finding screen ECG , deem clinically significant , Investigator . Subjects actively participate experimental therapy study receive experimental therapy within 30 day 5 halflives ( whichever longer ) Baseline visit . Subjects poor medical risk systemic disease active uncontrolled infection , opinion investigator . Treatment overthecounter topical medication treatment acne vulgaris include benzoyl peroxide , topical antiinflammatory medication , corticosteroid , αhydroxy/glycolic acid face within 2 week prior Baseline . Treatment systemic corticosteroid ( use intranasal inhale corticosteroid allow seasonal allergy asthma ) within 4 week prior Baseline . Treatment systemic antibiotic systemic antiacne drug systemic antiinflammatory drug within 4 week prior Baseline . Prescription topical retinoid use face within 4 week Baseline ( e.g. , tretinoin , tazarotene , adapalene ) . Treatment new hormonal therapy dose change exist hormonal therapy within 12 week prior Baseline . Dose frequency use hormonal therapy start 12 week prior Baseline must remain unchanged throughout study . Hormonal therapy include , limited , estrogenic progestational agent birth control pill . Prior use androgen receptor blocker ( spironolactone flutamide ) . Oral retinoid use ( e.g. , isotretinoin ) within 12 month prior Baseline vitamin A supplement great 10,000 units/day within 6 month Baseline . Facial procedure ( chemical laser peel , microdermabrasion , etc . ) within past 8 week study .
